jobs.title: Director of Operations
jobs.description:
Company: Virtual Internship Partners Ltd (Virtual Internships)
Location: Ho Chi Minh City (Vietnam) or London (UK)							
Position: Director of Operations
Reports to: CEO 
Start date: ASAP
Salary: £20K-35K GBP per annum ($25K-$45K USD per annum) to depending on experience
Schedule: Full-time, 9:00 to 18:00 Monday to Friday (must be prepared to accept that there are regular occasions when a task is required to be performed outside of normal working hours)	
		
Company Profile

Virtual Internships is a recent start-up that  provides remote internships with companies of varying size, sector and industry so that interns can gain valuable work experience with companies tailored to their choice. There are fantastic opportunities for students and recent graduates to do an internship with international or domestic companies, develop remote working skills, and not have  to worry about the travel and living costs, whether in another city in the intern’s home country or abroad. In addition, these internships can be done according to the student or graduate’s preferred schedule, since there are full time and part time opportunities, and so they can be done separate to, or alongside, their studies.

Introduction to the role

This individual will be responsible for all operational aspects within the company. The individual will oversee the entire customer journey, from customer acquisition to onboarding and customer success, and will oversee how all these parts align via the platform, CRM and other tools. This role will suit someone who is self-motivated, and is able to think outside the box to overcome operational issues, and always strive to make these processes more efficient. This individual will be responsible for the day-to-day running of the business and there are significant opportunities for career development and salary progression.

Tasks and responsibilities:

- Oversee the admissions, matching and placement processes, where candidates join the program, and are matched and placed with a relevant host company, managing the team members responsible for each part of this journey
- Oversee the internship program itself, and how interns are provided with their placement, coaching and training, managing the team members responsible for these different areas
- Work directly with the founders on high level strategy and change implementation
- Internal operations including accounts, finance and HR
- Ad hoc implementation and execution of ad-hoc initiatives as and when business needs dictate 

Requirements:

- Has graduated from a top university
- Has at least 3 years of experience in operations, strategy and/or consulting
- Ability to work in a dynamic environment, and is able to execute on a variety of wide-ranging tasks, on their own and within a team
- Able to take initiative and think creatively when overcoming problems
- Can understand various different perspectives, and how to apply this understand to a seamless customer journey that allows for revenue generating opportunities such as retention and/or upselling

Nice to have:
- Has experience as a CRM Admin (Zoho)
- Has experience making integrations between various digital tools (Zoho CRM, Talent LMS, Zapier, Google Drive)
- Proficient using Xero, Calendly and Stripe
- Is prepared to oversee aspects from a high-level, but is also prepared to get their hands dirty and execute on a variety of tasks
- Has experience working with customers and businesses, and is able to manage personal relationships with them on a large scale
- Has experience managing a team, both in person and remotely 
- Has worked in a fast-growing startup environment before
- Is open to the idea of travel and potentially overseas work in Vietnam or in the UK
- Native English speaker


Application procedure
Please send your resume & cover letter by email to hello@virtualinternships.com with the subject line: Operations Director - YOUR NAME
Application deadline: 26th January 2020 (early application is recommended)

jobs.title: University Partnership Manager - North America
jobs.description:
Virtual Internships is currently hiring for a dynamic business development lead focused on selling into US Universities.  Our University Partnerships team focus primarily on New Partnership Development with universities, but will also work to develop relationships with companies where the virtual interns may have the opportunity to work. The focus of this role will be to establish new relationships at higher education institutions across North America.

*KEY TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES:*

LEAD NURTURING & DEVELOPMENT
- Create new university partner leads through direct outreach, conferences, and networking.   Key stakeholders to reach out to include Directors of Career - Services, International Affairs, and Co-op Offices, and Deans / Directors of Undergraduate Business Schools
- Develop, conduct, and evaluate campaigns to establish contact with new institutions across the US
- Management of the business development process from initial contact, securing decision-maker meetings, writing proposals, negotiating contracts and closing deals.
- Collaborate with university partners to plan the logistics of the launch of new agreements

MARKETING & COMMUNICATION
- Work with digital teams and colleagues to create branded marketing materials to support business development activities.

CONFERENCE ATTENDANCE & PLANNING
- Work with the University Partnerships team to prepare for conferences, including scheduling meetings with key contacts & promoting sessions and presentations by the team
- Attend US conferences, and support the team in developing session proposals that support business development activities
